alert.note: Alert for Adams; Jefferson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 3:04PM CDT until March 30 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Tensas Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Central Concordia Parish in northeastern Louisiana... Western Jefferson County in southwestern Mississippi... Adams County in southwestern Mississippi... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 303 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Spokane to 6 miles northwest of Black Hawk, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Natchez, Vidalia, Waterproof, Stanton, Kingston, Black Hawk, Lorman, Sibley, Slocum, Spokane, Cranfield, Stampley, Deer Park, Church Hill and Ridgecrest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern Mississippi. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
